resources.string: Kotlin, a language designed by JetBrains in 2010 is a cross-platform, statically typed, general-purpose programming language with type inference. Kotlin is designed to interoperate fully with Java, and the JVM version of Kotlin\'s standard library depends on the Java Class Library, but type inference allows its syntax to be more concise.
Java, a language designed by James Gosling is a class-based, object-oriented programming language that is designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible

Python, a language designed by Guido van Rossum is an interpreted high-level general-purpose programming language. Python\'s design philosophy emphasizes code readability with its notable use of significant indentation.
Swift is a general-purpose, multi-paradigm, compiled programming language developed by Apple Inc. and the open-source community, first released in 2014.

JavaScript, a programming language designed by NetScape in 1995, often abbreviated as JS, is a programming language that conforms to the ECMAScript specification. JavaScript is high-level, often just-in-time compiled, and multi-paradigm. It has curly-bracket syntax, dynamic typing, prototype-based object-orientation, and first-class functions.
